definition: lit. to stand like the three legs of a tripod/tripartite confrontation or balance of forces
ancient cooking cauldron with two looped handles and three or four legs/pot (dialect)/to enter upon a period of (classical)/Kangxi radical 206/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes
surname Li
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
separation of powers

sentences.english: Changsha Dingli drives with you to achieve win-win development.
sentences.chinese: 長沙鼎立願與您實現共贏發展。

sentences.english: The formation of the Three Kingdoms, the Wei who is it?
sentences.chinese: 形成三國鼎立，那麼誰是魏呢？

sentences.english: Don’t worry about your expense to go to college, we will try our best to help you.
sentences.chinese: 不要擔心你上大學的費用，我們會鼎立相助。

sentences.english: In fact, besides the apparent cause of the opportune, the talents, especially the advisors had a pivotal role in the Three Kingdoms.
sentences.chinese: 謀士集團在三國鼎立中有着舉足輕重的作用。

sentences.english: The empire was once again divided into three.
sentences.chinese: 羅馬帝國又一次形成了三足鼎立的局面。

sentences.english: Our factory is well organized, fast parts leave time . we will offer professional support all the new and old customers.
sentences.chinese: 我們會對新老客戶鼎立提供專業的技術支持。

definition: competition between three rivals/tripartite confrontation
lit. the three legs of a tripod/fig. three competing rivals
to exist side by side/to exist simultaneously
to be perched high/to be located prominently/to be preeminent
a tripartite balance/compromise between three rivals
(honorific) your kind efforts/thanks to your help
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
to contend for supremacy
to unify/unified
to contend for hegemony/a power struggle
to plan to seize power of the whole country (idiom)
two tigers fighting (idiom); fierce contest between evenly matched adversaries
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
to set up an independent regime/to secede/segmentation/division/fragmentation
lit. hunting deer in the Central Plain (idiom)/fig. to attempt to seize the throne
